Gisborne seeking exemption from Government’s freshwater plan change freeze https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-seeking-exemption-from-governments-freshwater-plan-change-freeze/STH6FVXEUJERLIUROAIOVQDUUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/gisborne-seeking-exemption-from-governments-freshwater-plan-change-freeze/STH6FVXEUJERLIUROAIOVQDUUI/ Zita Campbell, Local Democracy ReporterGisborne councillors oppose Wellington's rule change, seeking exemption. Tue, 03 Dec 2024 16:00:00 +0000 Image of the Mōtū River in December 2014. The Mōtū catchment plan's notifications for plan changes are being pushed back until 2026 following a recent government rule change on freshwater planning, prohibiting councils from notifying freshwater planning instruments. Photo / Liam Clayton
